page.title: 12Changing Times In Sorbie
page.content: During the years,{improvements}have been made in the old houses of Sorbie. They were renovated and had both running water and electricity installed.Once,there was an outbreak of scarlet fever,but the people were not seriously ill.As well as there being a creamery,there were grain mills and small damask{industries}. In the 17th and 18th centuries 2 churches were built. The reason for this was that because 100 years ago,5 times more people lived in Sorbie than today. In the 1960's the loacl {railway} station was closed down.This was caused by economimc reasons and insufficcent travellers.Sorbie has always been a centre of {agriculture} and allied industries and because of this the inhabitants are proud of their village.
